seo.title: Positano Photography Guide: Best Spots
seo.description: Map the angles, best times, and etiquette to get great shots.

intro: Capture Positano like a pro: iconic angles, light planning, and respectful shooting etiquette.

sections.title: Classic angles
body: Shoot from the ferry dock for the full cliffside cascade; use a wide-angle lens to include the dome of Santa Maria Assunta.
Walk Via Cristoforo Colombo for layered balconies and bougainvillea framing the sea.

sections.title: Light & timing
body: Sunrise (around 06:00 in summer) casts warm light on the cliff—arrive early to avoid boat traffic in your frame.
Blue hour after sunset adds glow to village lights; carry a mini tripod or clamp for long exposures.

sections.title: Etiquette & backups
body: Respect private terraces and avoid blocking staircases—step aside quickly after taking your shot.
Store backups on cloud or portable drives nightly; humid air can fog lenses, so pack silica gel packs.

tips: Bring a polarising filter to manage midday glare on the water.
Keep a microfiber cloth handy—sea spray and humidity build up fast on lenses.

faqs.q: Can I use a drone for aerial shots?
a: Drone use is restricted; apply for permits well in advance and respect no-fly zones near the town and Li Galli islands.

faqs.q: Where can I print photos locally?
a: Photo labs in Sorrento and Amalfi offer same-day prints; bring images on a USB stick or SD card.
